session_type.title: Sleep Coaching for 4 Months & Beyond
session_type.short_description: Help your child establish lifelong good sleep habits by addressing any challenges now.
session_type.description:
Work with a sleep consultant to help your child establish lifelong good sleep habits by addressing any challenges now. The goal of this session is to provide an introduction to sleep coaching, and/or help you figure out a sleep coaching method that might work best. If you’ve already started the process of sleep coaching, this session can be used to troubleshoot any issues you’ve encountered. 

This session includes: 

1 60-minute phone call

1 week of unlimited text and email support
session_type.what_to_expect:
A sleep coach will review your child’s current sleep routine and help troubleshoot any specific issues, including sleep regressions, travel disruptions and transitioning from your room to the baby's own.
She will provide you with a specific plan for ending sleepless nights (or napless days).

session_type.title: Easing the Transition Back to Work
session_type.recommended_timing: At least 4 weeks prior to return to work
session_type.short_description: Work with a career strategist to cultivate a balance that will work for you now that baby’s here.
session_type.description:
Work with a career strategist to cultivate a balance that will work for you now that baby’s here. Topics may include negotiating a flex schedule or hours, setting boundaries, and figuring out how family fits with your long-term career goals.

Follow-up sessions available.
session_type.what_to_expect:
A career strategist will come to your home. 
She will discuss your work environment and review any specific concerns you may have about returning to the office.
She will provide you with tips for conversations with your manager or HR about any changing needs.

session_type.title: Big & Little Siblings
session_type.short_description: Get tips for introducing big sibling(s) to little sibling(s) and advice for how to help older ones, particularly toddler age, adjust to this major life change.
session_type.description: Get tips for introducing big sibling(s) to little sibling(s) and advice for how to help older ones, particularly toddler age, adjust to this major life change. This session will also help you anticipate behavioral changes, such as your older child suddenly wanting to be treated like a baby, or regressions and strategies for how to manage them.
session_type.what_to_expect:
A family therapist will come to your home.
She will go over ways to prepare your older child for the new arrival.
She will provide tips for a smooth (and fun!) hospital visit for big sibling and how to address any behavioral issues that occur once everyone is settled at home.

session_type.title: Schedule Your Welcome Call
session_type.short_description: On this call, we will get to know each other a bit more. It gives you a chance to ask any questions and me a chance to figure out how I can best support you and your family.
session_type.description:
Think of your Guide as your personal parenting pro. She will be your go-to for questions about all things related to babies, birth, new parenthood and more.

This short chat gives you an opportunity to get to know your Guide and for your Guide to get to know you and your family. *NOTE: Cleo is a family benefit, so we strongly recommend that both partners (if applicable) join.* 

Things you might want to chat about:

- Any prenatal health complications for mom and baby
- Any concerns you have about baby’s arrival, including around labor & delivery
- Any questions about nursing, pumping or formula-feeding
- Any challenges you’re currently facing or anticipate facing

This chat can take place via phone, Skype, What'sApp or Google Hangouts. Just message your Guide to let her know your preference.

session_type.title: Schedule Your Welcome Call
session_type.short_description: On this call, we will get to know each other a bit more. It gives you a chance to ask any questions and me a chance to figure out how I can best support you and your family.
session_type.description:
Think of your Guide as your personal parenting pro. She will be your go-to for questions about all things related to babies, birth, new parenthood and more.

This short chat gives you an opportunity to get to know your Guide and for your Guide to get to know you and your family. *NOTE: Cleo is a family benefit, so we strongly recommend that both partners (if applicable) join.* 

Things you might want to chat about:

This chat can take place via phone, Skype, What'sApp or Google Hangouts. Just message your Guide to let her know your preference.

session_type.title: Sleep Techniques for New Babies & Babies
session_type.short_description: Newborns need a lot of sleep — but that doesn’t mean they won’t protest your attempts to help them get it.
session_type.description: Newborns need a lot of sleep — but that doesn’t mean they won’t protest your attempts to help them get it. Work with a sleep consultant to help navigate the transition to self-soothing and bedtime routines and ensure baby (and you!) are getting quality zzz’s.
session_type.what_to_expect:
A sleep coach will review your baby’s current sleep routine and look at where naps and bedtime occur.
She will provide you with tips for encouraging baby to start self-soothing, discuss developmental milestones that may interfere with sleep and address any specific sleep concerns you may have.

session_type.title: Co-Parenting Happily
session_type.short_description: Reflect on best practices for caring for one another, your newborn, and your household.
session_type.description: Reflect on best practices for caring for one another, your newborn, and your household. Learn pragmatic approaches to sharing responsibilities on a daily or weekly basis. A thoughtful partnership can lead to greater satisfaction even when things are hard.
session_type.what_to_expect:
A family therapist will come to your home.
She will guide you through exercises to surface the ways in which you and your partner work together and how you could do so more effectively.
She will offer strategies to work through areas of concern.

session_type.title: Early Childhood Development
session_type.short_description: Meet with an early childhood development expert to learn how to build a foundation for cognitive, social, and motor development according to milestones at 0-4 months, 5-7 months, 7-9 months, and beyond.
session_type.description: Meet with an early childhood development expert to learn how to build a foundation for cognitive, social, and motor development according to milestones at 0-4 months, 5-7 months, 7-9 months, and beyond.
session_type.what_to_expect:
A childhood development expert will come to your home.
She will provide an overview of developmental milestones per your baby's current age.
She will discuss age-appropriate ways to promote healthy growth & development
session_type.timing: Second or Third Trimester or Anytime postpartum

session_type.title: Infant CPR
session_type.short_description: Learn infant CPR, or Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation.
session_type.description: Learn infant CPR, or Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation. Learn to recognize an infant in  distress, rescue measures for choking, and infant sleep safety. Hands-on practice with a mannequin.
session_type.timing: Second or Third Trimester or Anytime postpartum

session_type.title: Postpartum Massage
session_type.short_description: Geared towards your recovering body, whether you had a vaginal birth or cesarean.
session_type.description: Geared towards your recovering body, whether you had a vaginal birth or cesarean. Your therapist will ease sore spots, improve circulation and mobility, and help you destress.
session_type.what_to_expect:
A licensed massage therapist will take note of any particular areas of tightness or pain.
She will provide props, if needed, to ensure you feel comfortable and supported throughout.

session_type.title: Mental Wellness Postpartum
session_type.short_description: Connect with a mental health professional to discuss any changes in mood or personality, including postpartum depression or anxiety.
session_type.description: Connect with a mental health professional to discuss any changes in mood or personality, including postpartum depression or anxiety.

session_type.title: Postpartum Doula Support
session_type.short_description: A postpartum doula is trained to help families adjust to life with a new baby by providing support with soothing, bathing, napping & more.
session_type.description:
A postpartum doula is trained to help families adjust to life with a new baby by providing support with soothing, bathing, napping & more. She can also take care of baby while you shower or nap -- great for moms with partners back at work -- and assist with light housekeeping. 

NOTE: One session is typically 3 hours of support.
session_type.what_to_expect:
A postpartum doula will come to your home for several hours to support you and your partner. These hours are tailored to what you need!
She can review any newborn care issues that you'd like help with, including swaddling, soothing and bathing. 
She can watch baby while you take a shower or take a nap or just take a little bit of time to yourself.
